question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Determine the value of the infinite sum
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}}.\]
ground_truth:
We have that
\[\frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \frac{~\frac{n!}{15! (n - 15)!}~}{~\frac{n!}{17! (n - 17!)}~} = \frac{17! (n - 17)!}{15! (n - 15)!} = \frac{17 \cdot 16}{(n - 15)(n - 16)}.\]By partial fractions,
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]We can also observe that
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{(n - 15) - (n - 16)}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} &= 272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} \\
&=272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15} \right) \\
&= 272 \left[ \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{4} \right) + \dotsb \right] \\
&= \boxed{272}.
\end{align*}

inference:
Let $S = \sum_{n=17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}}$.
Using the formula $\binom{n}{k} = \frac{n!}{k! (n-k)!}$, we have
$$S = \sum_{n=17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}} = \sum_{n=17}^\infty \frac{17! (n-17)!}{15! (n-15)!} = \sum_{n=17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{ (n-15)(n-16)}.$$
Using partial fraction decomposition,
$$ \frac{17 \cdot 16}{(n-15)(n-16)} = \frac{A}{n-15} + \frac{B}{n-16} = \frac{A(n-16) + B(n-15)}{(n-15)(n-16)}.$$
Comparing the numerators, we have $17 \cdot 16 = A(n-16) + B(n-15)$.
When $n = 15$, $17 \cdot 16 = A(-1) \implies A = -272$.
When $n = 16$, $17 \cdot 16 = B(1) \implies B = 272$.
So,
$$\frac{17 \cdot 16}{(n-15)(n-16)} = \frac{272}{n-16} - \frac{272}{n-15}.$$
Therefore,
$$S = \sum_{n=17}^\infty \left( \frac{272}{n-16} - \frac{272}{n-15} \right) = 272 \sum_{n=17}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{n-16} - \frac{1}{n-15} \right).$$
This is a telescoping sum.
$$ S = 272 \left( \frac{1}{1} - \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} + \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{4} + \dots \right). $$
The sum is
\begin{align*} 272 \left( \frac{1}{1} - \frac{1}{17-16} \right) &= 272 \left( 1 - \frac{1}{17-16} + \frac{1}{17-15} - \frac{1}{17-16} + \frac{1}{17-14} - \frac{1}{17-13} + \cdots \right). \end{align*}
The terms cancel in pairs, leaving only
$$S = 272 \left( \frac{1}{1} \right) = 272 \left( \frac{1}{1} \right) = 16 \cdot 17 = 272.$$
Thus $S = 272$.
$$\sum_{n=17}^\infty \frac{17 \times 16}{(n-15)(n-16)} = 17 \times 16 \left( \sum_{n=17}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{n-16} - \frac{1}{n-15} \right) \right) = 272.$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{16}$
ground_truth:
We have that
\[\frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \frac{~\frac{n!}{15! (n - 15)!}~}{~\frac{n!}{17! (n - 17!)}~} = \frac{17! (n - 17)!}{15! (n - 15)!} = \frac{17 \cdot 16}{(n - 15)(n - 16)}.\]By partial fractions,
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]We can also observe that
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{(n - 15) - (n - 16)}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} &= 272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} \\
&=272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15} \right) \\
&= 272 \left[ \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{4} \right) + \dotsb \right] \\
&= \boxed{272}.
\end{align*}
